newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Solvay to sell Brazil plastics unit.
newsitem.headline: Solvay to sell Brazil plastics unit.

text.p: Belgian chemicals group Solvay SA said on Wednesday its 100-percent subsidiary Solvay do Brasil had agreed to sell all the shares it owns in plastic sheet maker Plasticos Plavinil to Occidental Quimica do Brasil.
Occidental Quimica do Brasil is a unit of the U.S.'s Occidental Petroleum Corp.
Terms were not disclosed. "Both sides wanted it that way," Solvay spokesman Paul Muys told Reuters, noting the deal was not yet completed.
Solvay said the disposal should be finalised on February 27.
Plasticos Plavinil, which provides products for the toy, automotive and other industries, had sales of $52 million (1.7 billion Belgian francs) in 1996, Solvay said.
Occidental, through its Vulcan Material Plastico SA unit, was active in the same business as Plavinil.
"The acquisition of the latter will allow Vulcan to rationalise its activities and increase its market share," Solvay said.
Solvay is due to release its provisional 1996 results on Thursday after the close of Brussels bourse trade at 1530 GMT.
